data.text: It used to be a useful app, back when it actually worked. However, that has since become a rare occurrence. On the rewards page, although the links work, the text is missing and everything else is so distorted that it is worthless. The same occurs on web pages and news articles. Uninstalling and reinstalling temporarily fixes the issues, but it isn't long before they return (or new ones arise).

This new Verdi of Bing has really hit it out of the park. My new AI assistant Copilot is extremely intuitive, this is the next level of AI, it has been an extraordinary resource and the best that I've found. Trust me, I have experimented with lots of ai and I am constantly disappointed. Copilot is a real game changer and will have set the standard for years to come. And its free!

Super flaky. Crashes constantly. Not only is this app backed by a second rate search engine, but they've shoved their artificial unintelligence agent into every screen at the expense of all other features. News feed is a spammy dumpster fire, and the rest of the app is just a hot mess. Bing, Microsoft News, Office, etc. All have been sacrificed at the alter of Copilot. If only it actually worked. Microsoft is obviously not in the business of writing consumer software anymore. Good luck Satya.

Just using the Nearby feature in the apps section, I hope we get a stand-alone navigation app from Microsoft. Also, it doesn't support Passkey. Please add it. I don't get it, who uses this app when there is Microsoft Edge?? Microsoft makes configurations so often. Also, there is a Start app developed by Microsoft which looks and works exactly like this Bing app.

This app is AMAZING! There's high-quality AI pictures and posters, image creator is awesome too! But there is one problem about this app, when you exit the image creator tab or something, it just freezes for a large amount of time and never responds...so please fix that! Maybe it is because I have a low quality device, or is it just a crash just in the app? But it still is very AMAZING and a VERY COOL AI app! This is my favorite AI app that I still use more than ChatGPT!!!! Thank you!üòçüòçüòúüòúü§©

Pretty flaky overall. Most features either don't work or only work sporadically. I absolutely hate that it creates a separate entry in recent apps for every single tab you open. Bing itself is an app and should only appear once in recent apps list. For some reason it randomly sometimes starts showing me news in the UK... Deals and rewards are all game-ified, but at least half the time you won't get any points for doing what it tells you to. Just don't bother... With the rewards, or the app.

I do not suggest getting this app. I got it to earn points to use for a game pass subscription. The app keeps force closing and have gotten no response from Microsoft after reaching out to them. Today I tried to redeem my points for an Xbox game pass subscription for one month and ran into a common problem and am unable to redeem anything. Also everyone that I am reading that has had this problem and tried to get help is not getting any response from Microsoft.

Cannot recommend application. Constant crashing upon entering websites where you need to enter information. Examples include WA Secure Access (FMLA), 2FA requests, filling forms for medical websites. The enter function when typing in the web sear bar doesn't work at times. Simply not acceptable, and I might as well just use the Edge widget instead. Device: S21 Ultra

Kept spamming my phone with the thing saying "Bing isn't responding". Would NOT work at all when I try to open the app,it goes to a blank black screen and saying Bing isn't responding. It goes to a blank screen when I touch the search engine I tried to sign in with a Microsoft account but guessed what it crashed and turn into a blank screen. I just downloaded this app but its already not working.

it's not always correct, but we already know that. the great thing is that the answers and points of view are as good as anyone else who has general knowledge of everything. I'm still trying other AI platforms, but this one is my go to for science stuff, more or less because of the category response range options (precise, imaginative, etc). It's not useful for reverse phone number lookup, however. It just tells you you look it up or call a service provider.

Love the image creator, however, after a recent update, images are being generated in landscape orientation and there's no fix for it. Also it seems to not recognize different ethnicities and skin tones. Prior to the update, I was able to create gorgeous images across the color spectrum. Now they seem to only have Caucasian skin tones and features.

Update: Receipt submissions consistently 100% denied for over a month with no explanation or recourse. Frustrating. Good but kinda buggy. Doesn't provide handles when selecting text to modify the selection (although you can adjust the highlighted area occasionally). Copilot loses connection a lot when you scroll while reading the result.

This was my almost exclusive search app for years, from all the way back when I had a windows phone, and I loved it. But now it just constantly glitches, freezes, and closes out pages and returns to the home page or closes all together. The problems seem to have started when they began to integrate AI more. It's a shame because I'd prefer to use Bing, but find myself having to use Google because it's more reliable, and I'm tired of having to start over and find what I was looking at.

Pros: it gives me gift cards. It has the Microsoft AI which can make nice drawings. Cons: the web browser absolutely sucks. The back button doesn't work correctly, it doesn't remember what pages I was on, and pages will go black unexpectedly. I use it for search to get points towards gift cards, but if I actually want to save a page, I open it in Chrome. Also, the first search result is usually an AI answer, which tends to be riddled with falsehoods.

I would really love to make this my default search app, but it will not stop crashing. Updating, removing, and reinstalling, nothing helps. While reading stories, the text will suddenly stretch and the app shuts down. It's not just an occasional thing either. In response to the MS response: I keep all apps up to date. Additionally, I have switched to a different phone (went from a flip5 to an s24 ultra) and it crashed on me twice in the past 10 minutes. It's clearly an app issue. Uninstalled...
data.replyText: Thank you for your valuable feedback. We suggest trying to update to the latest version of the app, which may help resolve the issue you're experiencing. If the problem persists, don't hesitate to reach out to us at bingappfeedback@microsoft.com. We're here to help!

data.text: Absolutely brilliant image generation that is only harmed by the most recent update that basically breaks navigating the image creation. I don't know what the hell they were thinking but it is absolute trash now. You need to open each image individually and then you need to open it again to download it and half of the time it shows the first image in a set instead of the one you're viewing making it impossible to download.

Its a lot of fun! my biggest complaint is it often doesn't follow all instructions, so it can be frustrating. Example: your prompt is "make a photo with 2 birds. make one red with an orange beak and one brown with a black beak." It usually doesn't get the colors right. not a huge issue. just more of an annoyance. Re phrasing it eventually works sometimes.

I like Bing Rewards, or did, but it recently underwent major changes making it much more difficult to achieve a payout. The AI "copiolet"is the best out of all of the AI's I've tried (Bart, Chat GBT, ect.). It gives you results that it finds on the web, with links to the sources and direct quotes for answers, making it more accurate. However, the $6/mo for office is annoying. I was supposed to have it included with my HP All in One, which was $1400+.

Before the update the app was great for me. Now it lags a lot and sometimes shuts down because of it. When looking at AI images, the app does not resize correctly, so the menu dots and cancel buttons blend in to the notification bar. When you hit download on a image, the image does not download any more, instead it fills up the entire screen zoomed in and there is no way to back out aside from closing the app completely.

The app is a disaster. Not talking about copilot which I have not tried. The app however never works properly. I get a notification for a breaking news article. Click on it and it opens the Bing app on a different article. Or, I am reading comments on an article in Bing, and when I expand to read more comments, it goes to the home page. The graphics are poorly designed. The interface cluttered and looking like it was designed in the 2000s. Maybe copilot is great, but I don't even want to try it.

I started using this for Microsoft rewards, and it's actually a good way to earn. not to mention if i have to look anything up, I can use Bing and get more rewards. honestly amazing üòÇ I did have a problem where it was telling me it only supported one region, and try not to travel around while using bing. but I was still in one area. it was quite annoying. which is why I have 4 stars

Of the similar apps I've tried the images are by far my favorite. I have had difficulty getting actual words spelled correctly on graphic images so I think that feature could use some adjustment because the AI can not recognize the error and is very confident even when it's incorrect but other than that I have no other complaints so far really. Sometimes the feature is unavailable because too many people are using it but that's understandable.

I've been sleeping on Bing. I decided to take the time to test Bing against the other AI apps that I had on my phone. And thank you, I was able to delete the others. It does everything the other AI apps and then some, and it's free. I particularly like that it has the option for you to turn on chatGPT-4 and dalle 3. It's slower than the others, but it's putting out better information, so if I have to wait a minute, that's fine. And I don't think I've watched an ad yet.

Entire display has been practically non-existent for over a month already, and it also keeps crashing/refreshing constantly. üíÄ I can never see anything I'm clicking on anymore, despite reopening the app and leaving it there "to load in" for 10+ minutes (nothing fixes it). It is now basically impossible to use and it seems there is no longer any way of seeing whether or not you even got any points for the day. üíÄ

There was a recent update that has been messing with every single aspect with the app. Any time I try to search for something, the keyboard wont pull up, so I have to keep going back and fourth, re clicking the search bar about 20 times before i can finally type. That issue has never happened before they updated it. They are so concerned with adding ai functionality that the actual web browser functionality of bing is almost completely gone due to all the bugs and glitches lately.

This app hardly works. Besides the sustaintial lag between clicks in the app, half the time pages will randomly return to the home screen such as in the middle of reading a news story. Content and features often do not load properly. And lets not mention the mandatory profile creation for the AI to generate images. This was a fun app, but seems every update this forth causes the app to perform less well than the previous version.

Started having issues with app randomly refreshing back to home page while in the middle of reading artices or comments. Very annoying. Update , the issues never went away and it's ahame because I liked the app otherwise, but it's ruined by constantly closing. Other than the constant auto refreshing, that app is great, I use it for news, weather, and rewards, also, Bing AI Chat. But, having the screen go back to the home page by itself is annoying. Please fix !!!!!!!!!!

Started to use the app daily instead of Chrome and really enjoyed it, especially with Copilot. However, at some point it started have lots of glitches and crashes. Most of the time when viewing websites or clicking a link it will go back to the home screen.

I really love the features of this weather app. It's one of the best I've used. Unfortunately, every time the display times out, the app has to be refreshed. This means you have to open the app to get it to work again. You should be able to open your phone and see the weather without having to open it up. It just keeps getting worse, so I downgraded my two stars 2 stars to one. Every time I try to search, I get a long pause while it says searching for connection, then apologies try again later.

Was fairly decent until recently. I enjoyed using it for rewards points, but the experience has diminished greatly. Near constant crashing when browsing news stories and 90% of the time the story you were reading when it crashed is gone from your feed when you restart the app. Speaking of news stories, it seems like MS pushes a lot of AI generated content riddled with factual and grammatical errors. Very mediocre MS product.

I enjoy being able to get my points on this app. However, it is not easy to get the news read for points. I still haven't quite figured out the best way to insure that I do, other than going back between reading an article, and hitting the read to earn button each time. I've enjoyed playing with the AI features. There is a lot to explore. I'm not happy that daily sets of points extra points changed from 10 to 1 or 2 points. I've been doing these points for over 20 years.

Its riddled with constant bugs. The search engine is so bad. Do a side by side with any other option besides edge which is even worse. Today again they broke the search so you get a few searches for points then it locks up for hours. This is with genuine searches, suggested searches and non sense ones. This is across all the platforms. If you don't want us earning points then take it away... They put their resources into getting people on the platform but don't care to fix known issues.

Bing is a nice app because it offers a clean and intuitive interface, provides relevant search results, offers useful features like image and video search, news aggregation, and integrates seamlessly with Microsoft products. Additionally, it offers unique features such as the daily homepage image, which provides interesting facts and beautiful images. Overall, Bing strives to provide a user-friendly experience for discovering information and staying informed.

Wont work. The screen looks glitched, I can barley click anything, and I lost all the pictures that I ai generated. Took a while to get them perfect. Keeps saying we have s problem on the other end. The best app. Now it won't work. Pls fixed and yes I will leave 5 stars after. edit: now ai genrate images won't work. Keeps making everything wrong, and it's giving me false info. This was working good, but now it's horrible.

For an app made by one of the biggest tech giants, it is incredibly laggy and very slow responsiveness. Sometimes you press to select and it swipes, sometimes you swipe and it selects. And now they nerfed the bing rewards so badly that it is not even worth it. After I get my last reward, I'll cease bothering with the rewards. If it weren't for the free, and helpful use of the Copilot AI chat feature and Bing Image Creator, I'd probably uninstall the app. If they charge or remove them, I'm done.

I'm not very happy how this app works on my S23ULTRA. I find it crashing and bugging on me constantly. It will make me lose interest in using that app completely, which I find unfortunate since I really like the concept. It needs more work and optimization. I've updated, restarted, and nothing changes. Keep up the good work and make this AWESOME app better!

Frequently crashes when trying to load certain webpages and pdf viewer crashes when you turn your phone to landscape. Multiple functions do not work. Can't scroll sideways on items that populate while searching for items. App also sometimes takes more than 10-20 seconds to open unless I kill the app and reopen it. The app now causes Android to prompt to kill it for being unresponsive the whole time I try to use it. This is even after uninstalling and reinstalling the app.

When I first asked questions of Bing AI when it just came out, it was thorough accurate, provided good, precise information. Now its repetitive, gives a long, much of it being irrelevant text, and pages it sites say nothing about what it tells me in the text. It doesn't encompass overall information from internet as it did initially when it started. Instead, it sites the same 1or2 webs over and over, too watery in response and has parroting pattern on clarifying prompts.

I like that it gives me points for using search & reading news stories. It doesn't always give me the points like it used to. Wish they'd fix that so it would work the way it used to do before ‚Äì I don't quite understand why a huge corporation like Microsoft has to make it harder for everyone to get points towards free stuff. üòï Other than that, there doesn't seem to be too many other issues with it. Still a good app overall... üëçüèªüôÇ

This app is just horrible. It crashes all the time. The AI photo generator sucks. It doesn't use English words even if you tell it to. It would be great if it ran good. Staying with Google chrome, was hoping bing would be a good all. USER DO NOT CARE ABOUT AI, it's not needed or desired. Sick of seeing AI JUNK. The app is slow if it even works. Try to type in the search bar and it goes back to the home screen. Just all around horrible

Its good when it works. Not sure if the problem I the app or my tablet. Everything is updated and my tablet is brand new. The Bin app seems to crash, not respond, lose connection or completely crash my tablet. No other app does this. I don't have anything running in the background. Maybe Onn brand tablets aren't 100% supported? BTW Image creator is awesome.

I like it. I believe I have learned a lot about the stuff I ask! If only "He" was slightly more responsive in response... I think I must need a better phone to use the app for copilot's speed to improve though! But I do like the layout of the answers and how I can depend on them being related to the question I ask. I'd like a little more humor just about near the end of an answer to lighten up please. Thanks for a great development of answers bing!

The app is almost eerily similar to the Google app in terms of search suggestions, default search bar layout, and the excessive placement of ads. I found the layout of the 5 buttons at the bottom with copilot in the center to be a bit more useful than Google's barebones style dedicated app, but the giant copilot button in the center is obnoxious and the incessant ads and irrelevant results really detract from the experience and make it feel just as hollow as Google.

Recently installed the app for Rewards points. After a few minutes the app freezes up. All this week, each time I use it. I have a Galaxy s22 Ultra and this is the only app it gives me such problems. Additionally I'm not sure that it's counting the rewards points properly... it all seems rather sketchy

Absolutely most frustrating experience for anybody who's been using a phone for longer than a year. It makes settings extremely difficult to change and does not bring in any of your edge settings watching this app is good for is the access the hobbled chat GPT that's if you only want to ask it a question that is not censored. Horrible.

I am trying to practice Latin with various AI systems and this has been, BY FAR, the best. All other AI make simple grammatical mistakes and butcher the language but this model alone, Copilot, has been excellent in syntax and vocabulary and grammatical form. I'm really impressed. It's also MUCH more creative and impressive than the other AI I've used. The only other one that comes close is Open AI. Anyway, this is totally niche.

We had a very difficult emotional and delicate question. No one wanted to deal with Google and the adds that have no answers. We used Bing AI voice search to ask the question. Although the Ai did question me back. wanting to know why I would be asking, lol it did answer and did well. My next voice to it was explaining why we needed to know something so out of the ordinary. The Ai was actually very kind, and gave more specific solutions for the issue. Even giving consoles for loss and thanks.

After a few yrs I was loving it till today when I launched it and it's not loading properly that I couldn't even do my daily's so have to say it screwed up my streak yet once again. I can't even check settings, can't send feedback, can't even get the settings page to load properly, I tried uninstalling app on cell then redown load which never fixed it & cleared cookies on cell plus desktop PC & all have failed fixing my issue. I sad I have to leave after being in program since launch.

I LOVE/HATE IT! on one hand; it's lots of fun and totally addictive especially if you're of a creative mind. On the other hand, more often than not it doesn't work, blocks your prompts and will often stop generating images for no clear reason EVEN IF it didn't block the same prompts before. It's just very hard to know what you're doing wrong. Especially if it's works for a while and then just stops generating, It can be very, VERY frustrating. It's fun but just not "great" yet.

The image creation is super cool. There's some parts of it where it could be better. It seems like it's someone who's super talented but no common sense. Like if you do a picture of a thermometer it will throw numbers and letters where they should be but it won't make sense or a football field and the lines are running wrong directions. Also it's too woke. I understand some of the creation rules for safety of certain people but it does go too far on censoring.

poor on answer. Problems with voice recognition. Answers are too long, not precise or not what you requested. Example. You request to show you a map, photo, or schematic of some tech, and it gives this long dissertation or history, not what you request. I've left feedback. Nothing has changed.

Typical Windows bloat overload. More bells and whistles than useful performance. Can't type "Hotels" into the search box? Then here's a Hotels button to take up 10% of your phone's screen. Now add buttons for Weather, Map, Grocery, News, AI, Chat-this, Chat-that ... blah blah blah and you can't see the screen anymore. It's all just a portal for Windows ad revenue anyway, so I guess it's to be expected.

News articles never load. Something always "goes wrong" and app restarts and still does not work. This has been going on since I got this app. I tried to use something Microsoft, but it unfortunately is a huge miss and I don't know how my crash reports have gone unoticed for so long. I can't be the only one. I tried uninstalling and resinstallling. Also, the app takes up nearly 600mb of space... How/why? Deleting today since it has been useless since September.

the ai is fun to use, just needs work on accuracy a bit. Edit: after the recent update the ai became much more dull and more unrealistic to use. If you just wanna joke around and tell a fun little story for fun if you're bored, it will flag it as "offensive" it's like the twitter of AI. Even when it was incredibly inaccurate, it was fun to use to generate images, make stories, etc. Now it's incredibly dull, boring and lifeless. It's like using a very unhuman-like human.

AI is so much cooler than I thought it would be. So far it works great. One example is how it shows me ads or results based on my live spoken words. That's in real-time, as I speak. I complained about one ad and it disappeared immediately! To check if it was just a coincidence/fluke, I said I'd like to see them again. Wow, it did...Mind blown! I'm so impressed and excited to see what else AI can do.

I love the results & responses.... If you can remember what you were trying to ask it once it finally loads. Doing a lot at a time isn't recommended. If it's the only thing you have open, it's awesome for immediate answers to general knowledge questions or simple minded suggestions. For advanced application & master commands & intelligent response: it's kinda demanding of your patience & distracting. "co- pilot" is an improvement, but not good enough to be considered a Finished-Product...(75%)

I have a lot to say about this app. I really like all the features that comes with this app, I can definitely find myself using stuff like the wallpapers, games, etc. I also like the clean, modern UI of the app. There's also Microsoft rewards which makes searching Bing a lot more fun. Unfortunately, the app is slow and glitches a lot (could possibly be my phone tho). Oftentimes, I have to close the app and reopen it to work. This makes it a big pain to use. Its disappointing because I like bing.

Love the AI. Very good search results and less biased than Google, I feel. But, extremely laggy. Microsoft: You'll have to slim down your user interface, make the A.I. integration / optimizations optional, and speed up your app to make it a viable option for many users. I would suggest a small moveable button with Bing's image on it, which can be moved around the screen. Short clicking/tapping it will bring up the menu, long clicking a search (the menu can also bring up search as well)?

The app is performing worse and worse with each update ever since the AI stuff was added. It is very slow and sometimes crashes. Edit: Now I'm not getting credited reward points for most searches for anywhere from several seconds to a couple minutes, making it painfully slow to get my daily points. This has gone on for a couple weeks. I contacted support, which was unhelpful and closed case immediately after telling me to reply to them if I continue to have issues.

I'm deeply saddened to write this review. Mainly as I love this app - it offers everything I want. Sadly, it seems to have hiccups within the app that cause it to crash and/or stop responding. My only recourse is to uninstall/reinstall it. Doing such allows me to reprieve, and I'm able to use all the cool features - AI, receipt scanner, search engine, deals, news, points rewarded, and even rewards for purchases made through the app. But these features all end up failing to work over time.

Just like most people here, I only downloaded the app for Microsoft's rewards. Other than that, it's a terrible browser. Sometimes, it won't let me interact with anything in the app and will completely freeze. I also want to know if it's possible to remove the AI because it really gets in my way. Speaking of that AI, the filters on it are so bad, I can barely use it and the experience is always unenjoyable. Overall, I'd rather use other browsers than anything that Microsoft has to produce.

The app itself works very well as a search engine. However, as an avid Rewards user, I've experienced issues with the news and deals portions. Whenever I click a news article, the app restarts and I am not able to read the article. This didn't happen with my previous phone. I went from a Pixel 7 Pro to a Pixel 8 Pro. As far as the deals part, the camera acts strange whenever I first attempt to scan a receipt. It will be off center and it doesn't always put the receipt in the middle of the pic

The Bing app is a perfect embodiment of everything wrong with search engines. It's clunky, slow, and irrelevant. Its search results often feel like a blast from the past, as if it's stuck in the early 2000s. Google's dominance is well-earned, as Bing's user interface is confusing, its algorithms produce subpar results, and its lack of innovation is painfully evident. If you're seeking a search engine app, do yourself a favor and steer clear of this outdated relic.

Edit: 2 months later, fresh install, same thing. Click on any news story and error message. I can't even open news articles. Got a push about an event, ok I want to know more. Click on it and just takes you to the welcome screen on app. UI is bloated, unintuitive and 99% of the stories as you scroll past the very top are just not interesting/important or clickbait

This is a Great app, I really like it. As an electronics Tech always observing and gathering Data; I found no problems so far Been using it 4 months now. Especially pleased with the Speech Recognition UPDATED: 1/28/2024@9:54PM I've Always Enjoyed the Excellent Service and performance of Microsoft Apps for the Android Mobile device. However in recent months up ToCurrent date, it's Been somewhat disappointing. Copilot is Inconsistent, SpeechToText Unstable; Often changes name from BING to COPILOT

App is currently unusable for me. Got a high-end phone recently and now I cannot read a single search result. I can make a search, get a bunch of links, click on one of those links, the app says "something went wrong. App will restart soon" and brings me back the the homescreen. This app is more horrible after every update. Is there any testing done before app updates are released????? Extremely frustrating.
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback. The sign-in issue has been fixed in the latest app update. Please update your app for a smoother experience. If the problem persists, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at bingappfeedback@microsoft.com. We're here to help!

data.text: I was given three boxes to pick from one was I Like Something, the second I Hate or Dislike Something and the third I forgot while writing about the the first two too. I was under the impression I would be given a space to either pick a service or product or a empty line to fill In. Bing was the next page after clicking I like something. don't get me wrong I like Bing the product just fine. the image I get is of a long nose animated flicking up and down while the his eyes cross trying to watch.

I like being rewards it's great, but the bing app and the widget search bar always take super long to open and let me type. at least like 10 seconds. First it's 5 seconds of a white screen then 5 more seconds where typing doesn't work. Doesn't sound like a lot, but when the Google search bar takes 1 second to start typing. It's hard to want to use the bing search bar over google. I'll concede I'm on an older phone (pixel 3a) but its a search bar, its the simplest type of app to load.

Since the most recent update a month ago, Bing has been slower than ever! The number of daily rewards for using the app has been greatly reduced (which is the reason I use it) as well. Not happy Don't like the newest update. No longer able earn reward points for using! All my bookmarked pages are gone. Screen is way too cluttered with stuff I don't want to see! Please fix it! I loved it before & used everyday - not just for points, but because I easily found what I was looking for. But not now!

Pretty bad search results. I try to look for things on bing but it's weighted around shopping or news when looking for obscure things instead of the site I'm looking for. The news feed is like 75 percent politics, all notifications of news are political which I cannot stand. Swear most of it is built around outrage clickbait. Weather reports are pretty good... But that's about it. If it wasn't for MS rewards I'd uninstall. The AI is interesting, but I wouldn't go beyond that.

Ongoing issue with News articles stop giving rewards after viewing 3 or 4 articles and you have to force close the app and reopen to get rewards working again. When this happens, the rewards summary also won't load and gets stuck on a Microsoft logo loading screen. Have the current version. Start app does the same thing. It's annoying and has been going on for a year or so
data.replyText: Thank you for your valuable feedback. We suggest trying to update to the latest version of the app, as this may solve the issue you're experiencing. Once the update is complete, please close and reopen the app. Let us know if you continue to have trouble.

data.text: This application is a disaster. You get notifications about news and weather and when you try to open them there is always an error that something went wrong. Now the same happens with the option to scan receipts. The only thing that works for now is chat gpt and the image creater. Soon I bet not even that will work.

I have used Microsoft Start for several years. Many times while using it, articles were cut off - nothing shows after you scroll from the first screen. When the Bing app came, it felt snappier and lighter to use, but in the past week I have been using it, the Bing app kept shutting down or refreshing so I will lose the article I was reading or I have to go look for it again and find where I was at.

Super laggy and crashes all the time. After upgrading to Pixel 8 Pro I can't open articles at all. The app just crashes and reboots. Tried wiping cache, restarting, reinstalling. Still works on Pixel 3 and other devices, but lags and occasionally crashes there too. If it weren't for MS points this app would be un-installed. I'm sick of dealing with all of its issues

Earning points with searches is painfully slow ( if counting at all) the daily check ins are hardly incentive- sure 5/10/15 points in the early days is ok but the 7 day? 20? It's fine but hard to make it worth checking in. The other "additional tasks" are 1-2 points which went way down from the 5 points per activity. It's really laggy. Also opening up multiple tabs when I go to close the app is too much. It was really good but I don't know what is happening with the program anymore.

(Oct 2023) A bad app that keep getting worse. Current, major issue include: 1. The articles page continually scrolls back to top when I try to s Recent (Feb 2021) update is very disappointing. Not that the old interface was great, but at least you could have multiple web sites opened at once, cannot do that now. Also, no longer counts towards Microsoft Rewards mobile search point (the whole reason I started using this app). If not fixed soon, I will just go back to google in my Chrome browser.
data.replyText: Thank you for your feedback Joe! We‚Äôre bringing the multiple tabs feature back soon, so stay tuned. For Rewards issues: please resubmit your comment at the feedback page in the Bing Search app so that we can follow up. It can be found in the '‚Ä¶' menu.

data.text: Downloaded solely for access to the Dall-E image generator. There needs to be a streamlined app just for that purpose. Every other feature of this app is unnecessary and undesirable. App is buggy with the 'tabs' layout, I'm often unable to reopen minimized tabs and then I can't figure out how to return to the images I've already generated unless I generate a new image, in which case I have to wait for my "boosts" to reload and I'm unable to proceed with the work I was doing. Very frustrating UI.

I'm having a lot of problems with Bing. It freezes up when I read a few articles. Then, I can't redeem my 26,000 plus points because Bing kicks me out when I try to add my phone number. It kicks me out when I input the first number. Then, my points are taken away. Last night I had a few points. Today, they were gone. And my 14 day streak was gone as well. Bing now says it's a 2 day streak. I like Bing. But, it's frustrating when it doesn't work. I may uninstall it.

Using Bing Chat with AI & GPT-4 has been quite a remarkable experience. Whatever you ask it to do, it does just that and much more. It gives all the information you need. I have barely scratched the surface of using AI and I am very excited to learn so much more. The sky is the limit of what anyone can learn using this magnificent tool. The possibilities are endless. Thank you so much to the Microsoft Team and the creators of Bing Chat with AI & GPT-4. Absolute genius.

Crashes all the time. You can type a comment, and it will crash then restart. You scroll downward, and it thinks it's a swipe and displays a different article. You tap on the comment icon, and it takes you back to the homepage. The entire thing is just glitchy. New update install, your UI still sucks. Crashes all the time.

Bing is allegedly a search engine, yet opening links crashes the app. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è (It's been going on for months) I don't care how much AI stuff you put into this app. It's worthless if you can't open a link. I'm using a Pixel 8 and signed in with a Microsoft account. Feel free to reach out to me if you need help debugging. Also inexplicably causes my Garmin watch to disconnect from my phone while using the app. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Been working with art ai for six months and Bing's ai is unmatched. Always liked Bing for searches. Straight forward and you get what you're looking for nine out of ten times. Doesn't matter if you're searching for auto repairs or case law it's just a very thorough search engine without all the irrelevant results. Just a great search engine with a lot of really cool extras.

Unimpressive & underwhelming, in spite of AI hype. App now crashes anytime I click on the News tab. Notifications linking to articles don't take you anywhere but the home page, making the notifications pretty pointless. Uninstalling & reinstalling doesn't fix it. Being signed in or not doesn't make a difference. Edit: After issue has gone on for months, reported through forums along with other Pixel 8 users, app has been updated, but issue still persists. Now Bing AI chat stopped working too.

I loved this app for a long time. When they added the ai chat option, it got even better. But then they wired the voice search button to the chat, so I can no longer use the widget to easily perform simple bing searches using my voice. The chat is really run and helpful, sometimes, but it rarely replaces a basic search for basic info. I don't need ask directions just for a snooty robot to tell me they don't give directions. Well Bing maps does, and it's used to when asked.

I use Bing for Microsoft Rewards and it is a CHORE. You can really tell that the same people who developed Internet explorer also developed this. The app is overloaded with so much bloat it doesn't even work half the time. I have to swipe away the app and clear cache multiple times just to get it to respond to the articles I'm clicking on. It's much more difficult to use than it needs to be.

It's a fantastic app I do recommend. I love how I can generate stuff. It is better than Google in many ways, like making images in stuff. Unfortunately, the one small downside is that the images that you wanted the AI to generate randomly are redeemed inappropriate even if it's not related to inappropriate things

I've only been using the AI to generate images, which have turned out great. Despite the hurdles of trying to not anger it by inputting a prompt I thought was safe, having it suddenly recognized as unsafe? As well, The image generator almost is never available now, always saying 'sorry, we can't create right now' why? Is it maintenance? Updating? I can only create with boosts,which refresh but there is no telling when they do. But as soon as I run out, it goes back to being unavailable, fix it.

Bing is a terrible search engine with unreliable results and a terrible app that often stops working randomly and will refuse to load certain pages. I only used it for the Microsoft Rewards program, but now that program is being significantly downgraded and phases out. There is no reason for anyone to use Bing without the Microsoft Rewards program and I will be switching back to Google Chrome, which does everything better.

The points draw me in every day. If you have a little fun with the quizzes, thats a small but easy amount of points. Using the search engine does as well, and scanning receipts will get you cash back. If you use Microsoft products (XBox for me) the points are easy to rack up. (I checked, it IS alright I end a sentence with a preposition)

I think Bing's Chatbot is a huge winner. Unfortunately, this app is barely functional as a browser. When the chatbot returns links, if you select one, you are in for a painful wait. Most of the time I search, I want to find a web page or an article. Too make that work here, I need to long press on the link to copy it, and then go to my regular browser to view it. Amazing to me that this app isn't built on top of Edge/Chromium ‚Äî or, if it is, how they have managed to screw this up so badly.

so far it's very informative. responses are almost human like but information is very detailed. It does all the searching and comes up with the best results to save you time. I would add that from my use so far, it's helped me to understand people better. Humans and AI actually have a lot in common it would seem. I'll leave it at that, purely speculation on my part of course.

Just terrible. I only use it for ai images, even that's shaky. Bing often crashes, randomly resets my chat, has a 4 reply limit, gets extremely laggy to the point of crashing, "new tab" doesn't open a new tab - it just overwrites the current one, image maker has VERY excessive guardrails, image maker is extremely glitchy - types out python code or image text code for no reason or just describes things instead of making the actual image. Bing is utter trash - DALLE-3 is great but wasted here.

Nothing but useless filler poorly disguised as relevant articles. It would be super if I could disable your little AI that tries to respond to every single search. I don't want or need some automated response for a web search. I've also never seen so many English spelling errors generated by a platform before. Especially one that is based out of a country whose national language is English. There's a reason nobody likes Bing. The rewards points are the ONLY reason I keep using this trash app.

Too restrictive, too one dimensional in responses. The responses are super slow when asking the bot to do any real work or research. The responses are super fast when it is making excuses about its missing the mark or being unable to keep up with AI competitors. It's almost funny when it replys with text as if it was possible for it to be butt-hurt and ends the conversation. Garbage app ... uninstalling.

Nice way to access Chat GPT and Dall-e for free. However, it's very slow with over 30 seconds for a response. The voice response, although pleasant, is too slow (cannot use 1.25x). There is usually a delay when muting voice response, and often stops responding when silenced. Without stopping voice response, it will talk for 2-3 minutes sometimes...way too much. Many bugs, but hopefully it gets better. I'd like to replace Siri and Google assistant on my phones.

Love this app so far! Especially the creative design feature, I have not even come close to being disappointed with the results and it seems to be improving as I use it more frequently. Like bonding with a friend you get to know each other as you spend more time talking ECT. Now your devices have a sort of grow with you capability. Definitely would recommend at least as an addition to what you currently use as your day to day. Thanks for letting me try this. It's great

This works great for my laptop and use it all the time! I downloaded the Start to scan receipts and I do all the activities for the reward points. But, on my tablet, it says it's compatible and it's telling me to download the Bing app but there's no download button! I've had issues with the Microsoft rewards system on my tablet! It's only good for scanning my receipts and reading news! I can't get the extra points for downloading it! I gave it 1star since I can't use it at all! Nothing to review

Decent search engine, but I had too many occurrences of trying to load a webpage I found from searches where it just loaded me blank screens. It takes me multiple refreshes to fully load a webpage. Also doesn't help when trying to pinpoint specific text it just gives me vague search results. Google is still superior in terms of pinpointing searches.

The app is very clunky and I know absolutely no one who would choose this app over a competitor like Google. The only thing this app has going for it is Microsoft rewards, and it doesn't even work properly. The app constantly freezes, and makes searching the web much more difficult than necessary. I highly don't recommend.

Terrible app. I've only downloaded it so I can get exclusive Microsoft Rewards points. Other than that, they pump the thing with negative news about war, parliament, death and they shove advertising down your throat. It's just another platform to pump rubbish in your brains like Fox News or BBC News does. The AI feature makes the app INCREDIBLY slow. I have about 40 apps on my phone and this is the only one which forces my phone to turn itself off and restart. In short, stick with Google.
